header.title: This is why you should never abandon your parents & family members: Nursing home 360 (Social video)
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: This social video takes you inside one of the nursing homes in the Moscow region, to tell the story of pensioners who sometimes feel very lonely & abandoned. Being all by themselves, they sometimes don't get to talk to anyone throughout their entire day. The RT 360 team shot this video in partnership with Starost v Radost (which may be translated as Happy Elderly Age) charity fund which is available at https://starikam.org/ . . Check out http://rt.com. . RT LIVE http://rt.com/on-air. . Subscribe to RT! http://www.youtube.com/subscription_c.... . Like us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/RTnews. Follow us on Telegram https://t.me/rtintl. Follow us on VK https://vk.com/rt_international. Follow us on Twitter http://twitter.com/RT_com. Follow us on Instagram http://instagram.com/rt. Follow us on Google+ http://plus.google.com/+RT. . RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 1 billion YouTube views benchmark.
header.socioLingVar: Age - Over 65s,Age - General,Age - Youngsters,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments

commentThread.commentText: Not a pet in sight,very sad.

I don't condone putting parents in elderly home, but people don't understand. In a city like New York where taking care of yourself is a full time job, the pressure gets to you. If you're an only child and you have to take care of two parents how can you do so? It's a horrible situation all around.
At age sixty now with poor health and this is me................it is horrifying to be alone. Every night I pray I don't get any older..............but it's HIS torment.

My Mother was put into 5 STAR NURSING HOME (I didn't have anything to say). She had dementia. She should have died a natural death in a couple of years but was deliberately forced to remain barely alive with adrenalin shots and other forced things. Normally this racket would have let her die when the money ran out, but a Hospice doctor came to this luxury place and happened to see her tied up. He examined her and said she should have passed away 2 or 3 years before. He had her placed i Hospice where she passed away. This medical kidnapping is common when there is an estate. My father left his entire fortune to her with my brother as power of attorney. My Dad thought money could secure her with good care...please, if you read this....money can't guarantee much in this world accept the friendship of those you help with it...Jesus said that. No institution can be trusted. If you have anyone you love in a home, a school, or anyplace....show up often in person...be a nuisance. Thank the Lord for that Hospice doctor.

Everybody get scare to be old, but it hit you the day of your 68 birthday or little later, is important to manage that NOW, any one need to have a strategy how your old > age time will be, please do it, to have kids warran ty NOTHING. They are thankful, BUT THEY HAVE NO TIME OR MONEY FOR YOU. PLEASE LEARN Do something now, do something every day, for that day when you will need, if you are old but you can be in your own home, pay someone to take PERSONAL CARE OF YOU, have a cat or a dog or both, choose your food, little garden, wifi, MAKE A PLAN. Don't be selfish, be smart, don't give your money or possessions away, don't be ashamed to ask kids and family for money, is important, MONEY IS THE ONLY SOLUT ION, nobody cares about anything BUT MONEY BUY, TIME, CARE, COMFORT, ATTENTION, EVEN FROM FAMILY, MAKE A WILL AND DON'T DISCLOSE IT, EVEN IF YOU ARE YOUNG NOW, PREPARE YOUR SELF, NOBODY WILL HELP YOU, UNLESS YOU PAY THEM. For those who already are in a difficult time, may God have mercy on them.

replies.commentText: We have allowed a culture to take over that is all numbers and profits with little tenderness.      Thank you for the blunt comment....I've seen people promise the dying many things...care of a pet,  care of property or even a child.   They weep and make promises.  Then next day the pet is turned over to animal control, etc.    Better to arrange with your vet to put them to sleep on your death....you'll be together.    TAKE STOCK of your family and friends...how do they treat you now when you are healthy?   Do they like you?    Do they take you to get your hair done or out to lunch?     FACE REALITY.

Love goes beyond the depths of what we think we comprehend. Love is more than "I provided you with food and shelter". I am only sharing my own opinion from personal experiences. I understand we all have different backgrounds and I will always acknowledge there are those less fortunate than me. I just know certain things weren't right when I was growing up.

commentThread.commentText: I have decided to become an aid worker in my semi-retirement years to love and help the abandoned elderly. My eldest son has abandoned me (thankfully i have two other children who still speak to me though they aren't able to be around much because of life) so I know what a horrible nightmare and devastating feeling it is. I can cook, clean a little and most of all love, listen and understand.
In Africa we look after our Elderly....the whole community does.

commentThread.commentText: I worked as a Personal Carer in the community as well as in an aged care facility an began my Masters in Ageing. The saddest clients were the ones that either never had family visit them or rarely visited. But when their family did visit, the light and joy that shone from their faces was worth all the sadness I felt for them. Sure you are told not to get attached to your clients, but I wouldn't have wanted to do a job caring for old people if I didn't feel it in me to care and that they matter. They were less concerned about their ailments than not having family around.

replies.commentText: Bless you...you will have many friends in Heaven!!

commentThread.commentText: I took care of my ill elderly parent for 16.5 years. Glad i did it. I helped them live out their lives as comfortably as possible. The experience helped me grow/mature...etc as a human being. Back in the 70s i saw on the news, horror stories from these types of places and vowed to myself if i was able, never to have my parent endure such places... Another huge factor that aided me was Jesus. Jesus got me through the very difficult episodes that arose...If anybody is interested in learning about Jesus, the bible teaching site...teachingfaith com has a very good beginners series titled, 'change of mind', that is more than able to help you understand salvation in Jesus. All the content there is free...

It's really cool how this video is like interactive, although it's sad at least they're not alone. There are others their age around them, it could always be worse I suppose :(
I am consider move to desert or barren area to plant trees.

My mom just passed last week but she did so at home with my father and I holding her hands till her last breaths when she died peacefully in her deep sleep with her loved ones by her side as it should be. Six years ago she was given only months to live but she defied the doctors and defied the odds and stuck around and mainly because she was loved and cared for by our family. My father and I took care of her and had to learn to deal with an amputee with dementia .We had a care giver come over during the week but not round the clock care . After 6 years we were tired and my mom had started getting worse with congestive heart failure and her diabetes was getting bad along with her kidneys failing finally after having to deal with a UTI and a C-diff infection . Her body just couldn't fight back anymore . After her last trip to the hospital they gave her only 24 hours to live and we wanted her to pass at home but the hospital fought us .They said provided she makes it through the night maybe they'll release her to us . She managed to hold out another three days without food or water or anything else at all,which gave us precious time to get her back home to die with dignity and respect with her family by her side . A social worker who only worked one Saturday a month just happened to be working that day after she was given one day to live and got her released for us .We lucked out in that way and my mom fought to give us this time . Putting her in a nursing home was never an option for us .She had been in one for a while while recovering from major surgery following an amputation 6 years prior and was always getting ill or infections and hated being there . As soon as we were able to get her out we did so . Things have to change with our society and we should honor our parents wishes as they did for their children . I realize not all situations are the same and some just don't have the option to do this as we did . It's because of love for her we fought so hard and sacrificed so much and made this happen because she would have done the same for any of us . Love can be an amazing power . I'm convinced that love alone kept her going when all others gave up on her . She passed a day prior to Mr. Stephen Hawking a great physics professor and another fighter who defied the odds and persisted . We picked up her ashes today and brought her back home where she belongs which was her wish . Perhaps it's just me but I truly believe love is what matters the most in this world of ours and that everything else is negotiable but not all that important in the grand scheme of things . We get too hung up on trivial nonsense and forget why we're all here . Fortunately I was raised to see what matters the most and to cherish what life can be. My mother pounded that into my head ! Lol May she rest in peace 12/21/41 to 3/12/18 😢

commentThread.commentText: I took care of my mother for the last six years of her life. She was blind and on oxygen 24 hours a day. It was difficult as I was a single father with two young children who I had sole custody of. In my mothers last days when she had to be in hospital she took hold of my hand and told me she hoped that when I was as old as her that my children took as good care of me as I, and my children, had cared for her. When I think of it I still cry. I a m old now but the world has become a complicated place for our young and I try not to burden them with my problems. I know I am loved by them and they worry about my health, diet and that I am alone. This video was sad to watch but it brings the realization that our experience as we age i s a common one shared by many different cultures and peoples.

replies.commentText: You have done what was required of you. But It pleases the universe and it opens up to you. Trust me. it is written and will be honored. Live well ChinaWatcher and know all will be well with thee.

As we get older, we can continuing learning, I don't like to be alone, and I love to talk, but little by little I see that the compromises and busy lives of my kids don't allow them to have the time and the patient to be with me and to heard what I want to share, I'm an immigrant in other country that mine, then I have no one else, cero family, cero friends, my treasures are that I'm very healthy, that I love to read, watch movies, videos, everything, I can cook, and I pray a lot in very positive ways, I can said that I have been a real good mother, but that at this moment is irrelevant, because I know that my kids need to keep up with the their life, work, studies, partner in life, friends, and money, money, money. I hope that I can live longer if I continuing being healthy, and I could control my desires, emotions, and sentiments to don't feel sad and abandoned, we born alone and we will die alone, specially in this millennial era. Be positive is the best solution for all the old > age situations, I wish you the best.

commentThread.commentText: I feel sorry for those who are in these circumstances! Being with one's family is the best solution; but that isn't always possible .... For many reasons. This sort of thing occurs in all countries where the young have to move away from their hometown or village to acquire an education or a job/career. People who live in urban areas and in industrialized societies face different challenges than people who live in rural area far from development/modernization. Do the residents have access to a library? Are some sort of organized recreation (scheduled bingo, holiday celebrations, other social activities, maybe a pool table, exercise room) available with trained staff? Are outings offered ... With help from a local church group (usually younger retirees, or people temporarily out of work) Is this facility a "Skilled nursing" facility ...... (for people who require nursing or who are senile) "Assisted living" facility ....... (with meals, laundry, cleaning provided)? "Retirement/" Senior citizen" facility/housing ....... (with apartments. The residents have to do their ........ own shopping/laundry, etc.. Sometimes with one ........ group meal, usually noontime, provided per day)

commentThread.commentText: If you mutilate the compassionate ones in your family so that they do not have the resources to take care of you when the time comes, this is what happens. You believed their compassion was a weakness to take advantage of, and you used it against them - now they do not have the resources to exercise their mutilated compassion, although they try to help in any way they are able to. This is what extreme forms of capitalism such as that we have in the USA, lead to.

replies.commentText: As Putin said: you poison the wells you must drink from later. My family is facing this right now. I try to help in any way I can, but I simply do not have the resources to do enough given that I must work full time myself - as a single mom - to support my family. I can help my mom in the mornings and evenings... but during the day I must work in order to pay rent/bills/buy food. There is nothing I can do about this.

Love, try though it may, can only do so much if it's mind and hands and strength have been mutilated and if it has to fight every day to survive. No one in this world - even Vladimir Putin and RT - should ignore or forget this.

Vladimir Putin - if you have mistaken love for some rock star and don't understand her (love) - or me - for what we are, I will be done with you. I believe in you so very, very much - but such a misunderstanding is symptomatic of a very grave error that absolutely must be corrected. These wires must - absolutely must - be uncrossed, disentangled, and wired correctly for evil to lose some of the power it has. It is absolutely imperative that the USA understand who - and what - it has impoverished and caused to struggle, and what it has uplifted and made rich. It must see through the deception that makes it mistake the one, for the other. Or does it know already? Then the world must see the deception made abundantly transparent to all.

commentThread.commentText:
The thing is, these materialistic and greedy mindset has pervaded the western culture and in turns, corrupted their family value. Children were forced out of their home to seek out their fortune by any means necessary with no cares of who they'll hurt, as if they're still stuck in a colonial era. Generations after generations, parents never taught their children first how to be a decent human being to his fellow man. Instead, they keeps breeding the selfish, uncaring, unattaching attitude into their sons and their son's son. In the end, the children lose the capability to respect and love, not only to fellow man but to their parents as well. A pitiful cycle.

 Finding a person to blame will not stop this downward spiral. This ice cold barrier of apathy can only be thaw with warm heart of man. Start respect and love your elders. Set yourself as an example for your children to see what its like to be a human, not a machined cog in the wheel of cold, uncarring system. So one day they would love you back the same way.

TEE-nuh ... It happens in ALL industrialized countries. (I responded because the op made a political statement ... That said ...) The longer a country is industrialized, OR the more rapidly a country industrializes; the worse the situation becomes People who live in urban areas have fewer children than those who live in today's un-modernized/semi-modernized rural areas (Where children are valuable for labor) "One mouth/two hands" is the old saying. Most older people; although they love their and often miss their kids and grandchildren; would prefer to stay in their "hometown" where their life-long friends and (maybe) their extended family, live and where they are long- time members of a church, clubs, etc.. But, the kids can't give up their jobs to move there. However, once the older person becomes unable to be independent; other arrange- ments have to be made. This can be very stressful for the children and parents. In addition; the lower the income for the parent(s) and/or the child(ren) the more difficult it is to make changes without the parents/children already living close by each other. Also, some older people live in rapidly- changing villages, towns, cities which can be very stressful for them. They can no longer do their own shopping, etc. because they can't get around; or the stores have moved to the suburbs; where a bus line might go; but where hiring a taxi to bring one home with one's groceries is VERY expensive. (And, some live in areas with soaring crime rates; which adds another layer of stress to the parent and children) With modern medicine and agriculture; most are spared an early death; but living a long time can be a different kind of challenge.
Here_We_Go_Again2 I agree 100% with all you've said, and I would add that there have been 'hidden hands' who have consciously pushed for these types of societies for their own selfish interests.
